item.title: [REQ] Autorestarter
item.dc:creator: @xsaberjrx xsaberjrx
item.description:
@xsaberjrx wrote:

                                                     [center][font=ravie]THIS WAS TAKEN FROM MY TUTORIAL[/font][/center]

PLEASE NOTE: THIS WILL TAKE 1 MINUTE TO GO BACK UP AFTER IT CLOSES YOUR RUNSERVER.BAT

Step 1: Start menu> Control Panel> Scheduled Tasks

Step 2: Click add scheduled task>Next and then go to your taskkill.exe file hit ok then choose daily and hit next

Step 3:Choose everyday and choose when you want it to start skip the next thing and just go to ok unless you want to put a password. and after that screen check the box that says open advanced properties. Hit finish.

Step 4: If you did not set a password in the previous step then check the Run only if logged in box at the bottom and then do this. Look for the box that says Run and replace EVERYTHING in that box with this.
tskill java /a
(see picture below)

Step 5: Go to the Schedule tab and click on advanced and make yours look like mine but with your own options. Then hit ok and hit ok again and it will be added. (see picture below)

Step 6: Click on Add scheduled task again and choose the same options but this time, you choose runserver.bat out of your server folder for the file you want to use. Go through the rest and when you get to the last step of the wizard hit open advanced properties again BUT LEAVE THE RUN BOX THE SAME THIS TIME. Check the Run only if logged in again if you did not choose a password and go to Schedule tab again. Choose the starting time 1 minute AFTER the taskkill one. so if you started taskkill at 6:41 then make this one start at 6:42 and LEAVE THE TIME ALONE If you made it run for 15 minutes on one then make it 15 on the other but the trick is to start the taskkill 1 minute before the new server opens.

Step 7: Hit ok and youâ€™re done! now your computer will auto update your server[br][size=1]

Read full topic
